channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Middle East Institute's Natan Sachs on Israel and the future of the ceasefire deal
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Natan Sachs with the Middle East Institute about the future of the ceasefire deal from Israel's perspective.

item.title: France Sends Former President Nicolas Sarkozy to Prison to Start 5-Year Sentence
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, reported to a prison in Paris weeks after his conviction in a corruption trial.

item.title: Judges Warn of ‘Judicial Crisis,’ and Universities Reject Trump Offer
item.description: Plus, a drastic drop in peanut allergies.

item.title: Nations Hesitate to Send Troops to Gaza, Fearing Clashes With Hamas
item.description: The Trump peace plan calls for an international security force in the Gaza Strip, but countries that might send troops are wary of danger, an unclear ...

item.title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: With the cease-fire deal under strain, Vice President JD Vance is set to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other leaders.

item.title: A theory why the internet is going down the toilet
item.description: A new book diagnoses a sickness affecting some of America's biggest companies.

item.title: Karine Jean-Pierre on why she left the Democrats — and calls herself independent

item.title: Grace Wales Bonner Is Named Creative Director of Men’s Wear at Hermès
item.description: Grace Wales Bonner is the new creative director of men’s wear at the French fashion house.

item.title: Blue New Jersey is expecting a very close race for governor this November
item.description: President Trump and former President Obama have endorsed the two candidates locked in a tight race for New Jersey governor, Republican Jack Ciattarell...

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress
item.description: Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stal...

item.title: Louvre Robbery Raises Questions About Security
item.description: Investigators were looking into the alarm systems at an institution that one expert said “wasn’t built with an obsession over security.”

item.description: Japanese lawmakers elected the country’s first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line conservative. Javier C. Hernández, our Tokyo bureau ...
